intro: Nauclea obtusa, commonly known as the African coffee tree, is a shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by elliptical berries that turn red when mature. Nauclea obtusa is known for its medicinal properties, with various parts of the plant used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. It thrives in humid, shady environments and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks.
